protocol.text: RNA was extracted from homogenized A. halleri root tissue with Trizol (Invitrogen Life Technologies) according to the manufacturerâ€™s instructions.

250 ng of total RNA, purified with RNeasy Mini columns (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) according to the manufacturer's directions, were used to generate double-stranded cDNA and subsequently biotin-labeled cRNA. The length of the cRNA products was assessed using an Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Palo Alto, USA)
cRNA products were hybridized to the array for 16 h at 45C in a rotating chamber.
Hybridized arrays were washed and stained in an Affymetrix Fluidics Station FS450, and the fluorescent signals were measured with an Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000.

CEL files from the Affymetrix microarray hybridization were processed by use of the R program and Bioconductor packages (Gentleman et al., 2004). The Robust Multi-chip Average (RMA) normalization was performed using the default settings of the corresponding R function (Irizarry et al., 2003). To estimate the amount of expressed mRNAs, the present call information of the non-parametric Wilcoxon signed rank test (PMA values) was computed with the 'affy' package (Gautier et al., 2004). Hybridization data from three biological replicates were generated for each Langelsheim wild-type and RNAi line 1-2.
